3C

3-C strategy (Categorization, Clustering and Classifying) aims to create a framework of well-asserted methodological processes of data analysis that allow the incorporation of expert knowledge, as well as interpretation and translation of the results back to clinicians.

  1. Categorise: variables are categorized into either assigned diagnosis (DX), clinical measurements (CM) representing the manifestation of the disease and potential biomarkers (PB) collected on the patient but the relation to the disease manifestation is not asserted yet.
  2. Cluster: variables are screened for the most important ones using the DX. Then the selected variables are used to create clusters. The clusters represent homogenous subtypes based on the disease manifestation.
  3. Classify: using the biomarkers we predict the clusters from the previous step. And find relation between clinical clusters and biomarkers variables regarded as "disease subtype signature"
